rComments: Very poor for 23a over the summer, there is no section and he teaches with theorms not with examples.

Once you get over his handwriting, and his occasional rambling, his lectures can be pretty enjoyable. He definitely shows enthusiasm for the subject, too. I think he's learning to be a better teacher and in a couple quarters, he'll have improved greatly. For now though, he puts thorough notes online to supplement his lectures.

His teaching style got better through the quarter, or I understood more as the quarter went along. The class is good if you a Math major, but difficult if you've not used to math. Lectures were difficult to understand because they are very precise and non-colloquial, but as he did example and people were willing to ask questions, it got better.
